alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 5:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL FAIRFIELD AND NORTHWESTERN HOCKING COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lancaster, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Bremen, Pleasantville, Hide-A-Way Hills, Fairfield Beach, Thurston, Sugar Grove, Rushville, West Rushville, Hideaway Hills, Clearport, North Berne and Dumontville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
